gw.datatype.handler

Interface IDecimalConstraintsHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IDataTypeConstraintsHandler, INumberConstraintsHandler
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IMoneyConstraintsHandler
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CurrencyAmountConstraintsHandlerBase, DecimalConstraintsHandler, DecimalConstraintsHandlerBase

    public interface IDecimalConstraintsHandler
extends INumberConstraintsHandler
    Numeric constraints handler specific to BigDecimal values.
    Author:
    pdalbora

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getPrecision

        java.lang.Integer getPrecision(java.lang.Object ctx,
                               IPropertyInfo property)
        Gets the precision of values for this datatype. The precision is defined as the number of decimal digits required to represent this value in non-scientific notation. This number includes the getScale(Object, gw.lang.reflect.IPropertyInfo) of this datatype. For example, a decimal datatype with a precision of 10 and a scale of 2 can have at most 8 digits to the left of the decimal point (as 2 are reserved for the fractional part).
        Parameters:
        ctx - the object that owns the property to which the value corresponds. May be null.
        property - the property to which the value corresponds. May be null.

      • getScale

        @Nullable
java.lang.Integer getScale(java.lang.Object ctx,
                                     IPropertyInfo property)
        Gets the scale of values for this datatype. The scale is defined as the number of decimal digits to the right of the decimal point for values of this datatype.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the object that owns the property to which the value corresponds. May be null.
        property - the property to which the value corresponds. May be null.

      • getRange

        Range<java.math.BigDecimal> getRange(java.lang.Object ctx,
                                     IPropertyInfo property)
        Gets the valid value range for this datatype.
        Specified by:
        getRange in interface INumberConstraintsHandler
        Parameters:
        ctx - the object that owns the property to which the value corresponds. May be null.
        property - the property to which the value corresponds. May be null.
        Returns:
        the maximum value, or null if this datatype has no maximum.
